race.name: Glengarry Games Gravel Run
race.tagline: Rolling gravel through Highland Games country in Maxville, Ontario.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Ontario countryside. Moderate elevation with rolling scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Local Ontario event. Rolling terrain with moderate access, low costs, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: Glengarry Games Gravel Run is a local event in Ontario—rolling terrain with moderate elevation. The Ontario countryside is nice and it's good value, but the small local field and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid local Ontario gravel race. Worth it for Ontario/Canadian riders. Not worth traveling for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Ontario—yes, it's good value. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Ontario races: Back Forty Highlander, Ghost of the Gravel.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Maxville has limited lodging options. Plan ahead.
logistics.food: Maxville has limited dining options. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: Ontario rolling terrain requires sustained effort.

logistics.explanation: The 2026 race date remains unconfirmed, and no packet pickup details are documented. However, the consistent organizing team of Brendan Gorman and timer Allan Hawley delivered 128 total participants in 2025, up from 96 in 2024, suggesting stable operations.

length.explanation: The Epic Course at 114km delivers proper gravel distance, with elite finishers like Stephen Chapman averaging 36.31 km/h in 3:08:23. Mid-pack riders finished 5-27 minutes back, showing the distance creates meaningful separation across skill levels. More compact than Grinduro.

technicality.explanation: Rolling gravel roads through the United Counties create moderate technical challenge, finishing with a distinctive 3/4 lap of the Highland Games oval track in front of spectators. The low 6% DNF rate suggests manageable difficulty for prepared riders. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: Rolling hills around Maxville provide steady climbing without overwhelming elevation. The course features enough vertical to separate riders - elite times ranged from 3:08 to 5:14 on the Epic Course, indicating elevation creates meaningful time gaps. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 77°F and lows of 61°F, with a 64% chance of rain on any given day. August conditions in eastern Ontario proved manageable in recent years, with consistently low DNF rates of 3-6% across categories. The stable finish times suggest weather hasn't been a major factor in recent editions. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Eastern Ontario elevation poses no breathing challenges. The United Counties of Stormont, Dundas & Glengarry sit at modest elevations that don't affect performance or require acclimatization. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Shane Hotchkiss describes Ontario gravel events as "more like an adventure than a race," capturing the spirit of these rolling countryside routes. The finish through Highland Games grounds adds cultural adventure most races lack.

prestige.explanation: This remains a regional Ontario event, though integration with the Highland Games provides unique spectator atmosphere. Growing from 96 to 128 participants shows local credibility, but it's not a destination race drawing national fields.

race_quality.explanation: The Highland Games partnership creates an unusual spectacle finish with "giant covered grandstands in front of hundreds of spectators." Consistent timing by Allan Hawley and year-over-year growth indicates reliable race execution.

experience.explanation: The Highland Games integration provides festival atmosphere and spectator finale unlike typical gravel finishes. The oval track conclusion in front of grandstands creates a proper celebration environment that elevates the standard gravel experience.

community.explanation: Partnership with the Glengarry Highland Games delivers hundreds of spectators for the finish, creating community engagement most gravel races lack. Growth from 96 to 128 riders indicates building local following and repeat participation.

field_depth.explanation: Top Epic finishers Stephen Chapman, Bayden Pritchard, and William Goodfellow finished within one second, showing tactical racing at the front. However, the 49-rider Epic field remains regional in scope without documented elite depth. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: The Highland Games partnership delivers unique spectator atmosphere and festival access alongside the cycling event. Three distance options (42km-114km) at $80-110 CAD provide solid value for the distinctive finish experience.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $50-75 CAD. Maxville, Ontario isn't a resort destination, so lodging costs stay reasonable. Being part of the Highland Games means you're competing with festival-goers for accommodations, but eastern Ontario doesn't command Montreal or Toronto pricing. The 'no refunds, no transfers' policy means you better be committed once you register. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

citations.label: RideWithGPS: Glengarry Games Gravel Run MEDIO

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: Glengarry Games Gravel Run gravel race Maxville

videos.title: Glengarry Highland Games Gravel Run (Gravel Cup Canada)
videos.description:
We had an amazing time in Maxville, Ontario, for the inaugural Glengarry Highland Games Gravel Run! Such an awesome event with gorgeous weather, and a beautiful area for some gravel riding! As always, a big thank you to the Gravel Cup Canada team for organizing an incredible cycling experience for all levels of riders! 

Next event: 

BACK FORTY HIGHLANDER
Black Forty Artisan Cheese
September 7, 2024

LINK IN BIO FOR DETAILS

#gravelcupcanada #cycling #gravelbikes #gravelcycling #ontariocycling #cyclingcanada #Ontario #maxville #giro #kunstadt

videos.curation_reason: First-person race recap showing the event atmosphere, rider interviews, and finish at the Highland Games fairgrounds track.

videos.title: Graydon Corsi Glengarry Highland Games Gravel Run 2025
videos.description: This video was made with Clipchamp

videos.title: Gravel Cup Canada - Maxville Course Preview
videos.description:
A new event in partnership with the Glengarry Highland Games!

The Glengarry Highlands Gravel Run uses the rolling gravel roads around Maxville in the United Counties of Stormont, Dundas & Glengarry. It then finishes with a 3/4 lap of an oval track in front of the giant covered grandstands in front of hundreds of spectators. With a 40km, 80km, and 120km route to choose from, there is a ride for everyone!

Register now at gravelcup.com! (link in bio)

#cycling #gravebikes #gravelcycling #biking #gravecupcanada #ottawa #maxville #ontario #canada

videos.curation_reason: Course preview video showing specific terrain details including gravel roads, trail sections, and the unique oval track finish.

quotes.text: We got to finish around the track under the big stat Arch it's going to be great... The Finish is going to be on the oval track in front of the giant Grand stands that they use for the Glen Gary Highland Games there's going to be loads of people there cheering the riders in.

So the majority of this ride is going to be just normal gravel roads and probably a significant amount of pavement, but you try to throw in some stuff to make the route interesting... there's going to be a few Trail sections some of them might need a little bit more time to dry out.

key_challenges.name: McDonald's Side Road
key_challenges.description: Called a favorite section by riders, described as shaded with trees and narrow. Nice maintained gravel road around Loch Gary that's sheltered from wind with minimal traffic.

terrain_notes.text: Course features old logging roads and unmaintained sections that need time to dry out, though some remain solid even when wet. Mix of normal gravel roads and significant pavement sections.
Several maintained gravel roads go through municipally designated conservation forests, providing shaded and sheltered riding.

race_day_tips.text: Drink a lot of water and pour some over your head due to heat. There's water available at aid stations.
There will be a neutral start following the race organizer out of town to the other side before the race begins.

additional_quotes.text: The Finish is going to be on the oval track in front of the giant Grand stands that they use for the Glen Gary Highland Games there's going to be loads of people there cheering the riders in
There's going to be a neutral start so you'll follow Brandon out account it'll stop you uh on the other side of town there and see the other so no rush through here just safely through town

rider_intel.search_text: The Glengarry Games Gravel Run features a mix of normal gravel roads, significant pavement sections, and trail sections including old logging roads and unmaintained areas. Key highlights include McDonald's Side Road, a favorite shaded section that's narrow and sheltered from wind with minimal traffic. The course incorporates maintained gravel roads through municipally designated conservation forests. Some unmaintained sections may need time to dry out, though riders found them solid even when wet. The race finishes dramatically on the oval track at the Highland Games fairgrounds in front of grand stands with crowds cheering. Heat is a significant factor requiring lots of water and cooling strategies. The event features a neutral start through downtown Maxville before the competitive portion begins. Aid stations provide water support throughout the course.
